org.apache.mesos.reconciliation

Class DefaultReconciler

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.mesos.reconciliation.DefaultReconciler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Reconciler

    public class DefaultReconciler
extends java.lang.Object
implements Reconciler
    Default implementation of Reconciler. See Reconciler for docs.

      • DefaultReconciler

        public DefaultReconciler(StateStore stateStore)

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public void start()
        Description copied from interface: Reconciler
        Starts reconciliation against the provided tasks, which should represent what the Scheduler currently knows about task status.

        NOTE: THIS CALL MUST BE THREAD-SAFE AGAINST OTHER RECONCILER CALLS

        Specified by:
        start in interface Reconciler

      • reconcile

        public void reconcile(SchedulerDriver driver)
        This function is expected to be called repeatedly. It executes the following pseudocode across multiple calls: unreconciledList = tasksKnownByScheduler // provided by start() while (!unreconciledList.isEmpty()) { // explicit reconciliation (PHASE 1) if (timerSinceLastCallExpired) { driver.reconcile(unreconciledList); } } driver.reconcile(emptyList); // implicit reconciliation (PHASE 2)
        Specified by:
        reconcile in interface Reconciler
        Parameters:
        driver - The SchedulerDriver instance that the Reconciler should use to query the Mesos master for TaskStatus.

      • update

        public void update(Protos.TaskStatus status)
        Description copied from interface: Reconciler
        Used to update the Reconciler with current task status. This is effectively an asynchronous callback which is triggered by a call to reconcile().

        NOTE: THIS CALL MUST BE THREAD-SAFE AGAINST OTHER RECONCILER CALLS

        Specified by:
        update in interface Reconciler
        Parameters:
        status - The TaskStatus used to update the Reconciler.

      • remaining

        public java.util.Set<java.lang.String> remaining()
        Description copied from interface: Reconciler
        Returns the set of known unreconciled task ids as Strings. Note that an empty list does NOT mean that reconciliation is complete. Use Reconciler.isReconciled() to determine completeness.

        NOTE: THIS CALL MUST BE THREAD-SAFE AGAINST OTHER RECONCILER CALLS

        Specified by:
        remaining in interface Reconciler
        See Also:
        Reconciler.isReconciled()

      • forceComplete

        public void forceComplete()
        Description copied from interface: Reconciler
        Forces reconciliation into a complete state. This may result in inconsistent task state between Mesos and the Framework Scheduler, so calling it is not recommended.

        NOTE: THIS CALL MUST BE THREAD-SAFE AGAINST OTHER RECONCILER CALLS

        Specified by:
        forceComplete in interface Reconciler

      • isReconciled

        public boolean isReconciled()
        Description copied from interface: Reconciler
        Returns whether reconciliation is complete.

        NOTE: THIS CALL MUST BE THREAD-SAFE AGAINST OTHER RECONCILER CALLS

        Specified by:
        isReconciled in interface Reconciler

      • getCurrentTimeMillis

        protected long getCurrentTimeMillis()
        Time retrieval broken out into a separate function to allow overriding its behavior in tests.
